card.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc
card.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Employees must show their identity cards at the gate.
I haven’t got my membership card yet.
card.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a small piece of plastic, especially one that you get from a bank or shop, which you use to pay for goods or to get money
card.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Lost or stolen cards must be reported immediately.
Every time you use your store card, you get air miles.
card.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a piece of folded thick stiff paper with a picture on the front, that you send to people on special occasions
card.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a card with a photograph or picture on one side, that you send to someone when you are on holiday
card.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I sent you a card from Madrid.
card.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Cut a piece of white card 12 × 10 cm.
card.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a small piece of thick stiff paper that information can be written or printed on
card.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a small piece of thick stiff paper with numbers and signs or pictures on one side. There are 52 cards in a set.
pack/deck of cards (=a complete set of cards)
card.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a game in which these cards are used
card.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: We were having a game of cards.
card.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: a small piece of thick stiff paper with numbers or pictures on them, used to play a particular game
card.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: a set of cards for playing Snap
card.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: a small piece of thick stiff paper that shows your name, job, and the company you work for
card.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: My name’s Adam Carver. Here’s my card.
card.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: a piece of equipment inside a computer that the chips are attached to, that allows the computer to do specific things
card.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: Fred’s a real card, isn’t he!
card.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: a small piece of stiff red or yellow paper, shown to a player who has done something wrong in a game such as football
card.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: a list of races or matches at a sports event, especially a horse race
card.translation[0].definitions[13].exam: a full card of 120 riders for the Veterans race
card.translation[0].definitions[14].defi: a small piece of thick stiff paper with a special picture on one side, that is put down in a pattern in order to tell someone what will happen in their future
card.translation[0].definitions[15].defi: a tool that is similar to a comb and is used for combing, cleaning, and preparing wool or cotton for spinning (spin)
card.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc
card.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: All US citizens must carry an identity card.
Do you have a library membership card?
Entrance is free if you have a student card.
You will need to bring your medical card.
The dentist gave me a new appointment card.
Swipe cards are used to enhance security.
Keeping medical records on small plastic smart cards seems to be a success.
You may need a new sim card when you travel abroad.
We want to encourage more people to carry a donor card.
Motorists could soon be forced to carry an ID card.
He flashed his ID card at the guard and walked straight in.
card.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a small piece of plastic, especially one that you get from a bank or shop, which you use to pay for goods or to get money
card.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: He had paid by credit card.
The store only accepts debit cards.
You should report stolen cash cards immediately.
Always keep your cheque book and cheque card separately.
Store cards often have high rates of interest.
You can use this phone card in several countries.
1 in 10 store card holders owes more than £500.
Many consumers are afraid of credit card fraud.
Hackers stole hundreds of people's card details.
Is it all right if I pay by card?
I’ll put the restaurant bill on my card.
I don’t use a card if I can pay by cash.
Big hotels will accept most cards.
card.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to ask someone to show a card proving that they are old enough to do something, especially to buy alcohol
card.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to show a red or yellow card to someone playing a sport such as football, to show that they have done something wrong
card.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to comb, clean, and prepare wool or cotton, before making cloth
card.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a small piece of plastic or paper that shows that someone belongs to an organization, club etc
card.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Employees must show their ID cards at the gate.
All members are issued with a membership card.
card.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a small piece of stiff paper or plastic that stores information about someone or something
card.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: A helpful device is to print your presentation ideas on separate index cards.
card.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: a small piece of plastic that you use to pay for goods or to get money from a machine at a bank
card.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Lost or stolen cards must be reported immediately.
card.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: a small piece of thick stiff paper that shows your name, job, and the company you work for
card.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: I’ll leave my card and you can contact me when it suits you.
card.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: a part inside a computer to which chips are fixed, that allows the computer to do specific things
